intro: Rudgea jasminoides subsp. nervosa, commonly known as the narrow-veined rudgea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that resemble those of jasmine. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that have distinct venation patterns. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
